page.title: 02FARMING IN BURNHAM MARKET 1
page.content: The survey area includes 9 farms and three groups of allotments: Sussex Farm (2,275 acres), Crabbe Hall (730 acres), Cradle Hall and Crow Hall (680 acres), Muckleton (680 acres), Gallow Hill Farm (150 acres), Friar's Thorne Farm (111 acres), Chalk Farm (100 acres), Sunnymead (39\ acres) and Westgate (30 acres). All except for Crabbe Hall (tenanted from Holkham estate) are owner-farmed. Friar's Thorne, Cradle Hall and Crow Hall all belong to members of the same family, which also used to own Muckleton. 25 people are permanently employed on these farms, with two Youth Training Scheme workers at Westgate Farm and variable numbers of seasonal workers at most farms. Chalk Hill Farm, Gallow Hill Farm and Sunnymead use outside contractors for all their work.
